intro: Huperzia martii, commonly known as the Chinese clubmoss, is a species of vascular plant belonging to the family Huperziaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, scale-like leaves that form dense, compact clusters. Native to regions of East Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea, this plant thrives in moist, shaded forest environments. Huperzia martii is a perennial plant that reproduces through spores, typical of the lycophyte group. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
